page.title: 19LEGEND OF BISHOP AUCKLAND-2
page.content: {(continued from Page 18) } When Pollard awoke, he was dismayed to find the boar's head missing, until he remembered the tongue in his pocket and he went straight to the Bishop's Palace. He was not too soon, for the Bishop was just thanking the stranger for his bravery. Pollard cried out,"It was I who killed the boar!", but the Bishop showed him the boar's head the stranger had brought and asked for Pollard's proof. Pollard showed him the tongue and the Bishop saw that he had truly killed the beast and offered him as reward as much land as Pollard could ride round while the Bishop dined. After the Bishop had dined, Pollard said,"I have ridden no farther than round your own castle!" {(continued on Page 20)
